intro: Teucrium caucasicum, commonly known as Caucasian germander, is a perennial herb native to the Caucasus region. It typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and features opposite, lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or mountainous areas. The plant is known for its aromatic foliage and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
